misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of a broken or risky cryptographic algorithm, such as the use of the DES encryption algorithm, is vulnerable to attacks such as brute force attacks and can be exploited to access sensitive data.
recommendation: Use a more secure cryptographic algorithm, such as AES, and use a stronger key, such as a 256-bit key, and a more secure mode, such as CBC or GCM mode, to protect sensitive data.

misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation
description: The selection of a less-secure algorithm during negotiation, such as the use of a 64-bit key, is vulnerable to attacks such as brute force attacks and can be exploited to access sensitive data.
recommendation: Use a more secure key, such as a 256-bit key, and a more secure algorithm, such as AES, to protect sensitive data.
